name: Solve real life problems with positive and negative rational numbers

skills.name: Solve problems that combine addition and subtraction
Subtract proper fractions with different denominators which do not share a common factor
Express one quantity as a percentage of another mentally
Find the whole amount given a percentage of the amount mentally
Solve money problems using the 4 operations where the currency is dollars

explanations.A: I think you may have assumed since percents are out of 100, this test had 100 questions, but that is not the case. If the student got 75% correct, then the 15 questions wrong would represent 25%. How can we use that to find 100%?
explanations.B: I think you may have divided 15 by 0.75, but 15 represents the questions he got wrong, so represents 25%...
explanations.C: It looks like you multiplied 15 by 3, since 0.75 is three-quarters. Instead, we want to know what is the number if 25% of it is 15?
explanations.D: 0.25 x ùëõ = 15, so 15 √∑ 0.25 = 60. There are 60 questions on the test!

explanations.A: It looks like you multiplied 18 by 3, since 0.75 is three-quarters. Instead, we want to know what is the number if 25% of it is 18?
explanations.B: I think you may have assumed since percents are out of 100, this test had 100 questions, but that is not the case. If the student got 75% correct, then the 18 questions wrong would represent 25%. How can we use that to find 100%?
explanations.C: 0.25 x ùëõ = 18, so 18 √∑ 0.25 = 72. There are 72 questions on the test!
explanations.D: I think you may have divided 18 by 0.75, but 18 represents the questions he got wrong, so represents 25%...

explanations.A: I think you may have used the area of the smaller rectangle as the percent. We need to compare the area of the smaller rectangle to the area of the larger rectangle to determine the percent.
explanations.C: I think you may have used the area of the larger rectangle as the percent. We need to compare the area of the smaller rectangle to the area of the larger rectangle to determine the percent.
explanations.D: Close, but you found the percent of the area that is unshaded. What percent of the figure is shaded?
